result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas A Bohlmann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber with all standard release conditions
IF REVOKED 7 days sentence credit
Concurrent with: Any other sentence

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge to be paid as a condition of probation

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended

Absolute sobriety, random UA's

No use or possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia

No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent

No VIOLENT contact with victims listed in the criminal complaint

Domestic violence counseling

No use or possession of any dangerous weapons

Mental health evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate

supervisions.notes:
Huber with all standard release conditions
Concurrent with: Any other sentence

miscConds.notes: Court costs and DNA surcharge to be paid as a condition of probation

11:06 AM Defendant Nicholas A Bohlmann in court.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Nicholas A Bohlmann.  Prosecuting attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Court conducts a plea colloquy with defendant. 
Defendant enters a plea of guilty to Count 1 and 2. 
Court finds the defendant guilty to Count 1 and 2. 
Court dismisses and reads in Case 22CM1072


Court orders the following:
Count 1
90 DAYS  Waukesha County Jail with Huber, all standard release conditions.
7 Days credit if revoked
concurrent to any other sentence
STAYED for PROBATION

Term of Probation: 18 MONTHS
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
 AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
 Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.'s ; 
 No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
 No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
 Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
 No VIOLENT contact with:  victims listed in the criminal complaint
 DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
 Domestic Violence Counseling
 No use or possession of any dangerous weapons
 Mental Heath evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

COSTS:  $243.00
D/V SURCHARGE: $100.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $200.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Count 2
Court orders the following:
90 DAYS  Waukesha County Jail with Huber, all standard release conditions.

11:01 AM Defendant Nicholas A Bohlmann in court.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Nicholas A Bohlmann.  Prosecuting attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
State has a global offer in this matter and looking further it could be read two different ways. 
State reports victims are not present today. 
Atty Griffis does request a new date to clarify offer and have victims appear in person.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 4, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 23, 2022 at 11:00 am.

dated 9/8/22 from Atty Griffis re: adjournment request

**Reviewed by Judge Bugenhagen Jr. on 09-08-2022: The matter may be rescheduled.**
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 12, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no VIOLENT contact with victim A  and no contact with victim B listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.    Defendant to have no VIOLENT contact with witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

11:37 AM Defendant Nicholas A Bohlmann in court with attorney Justin G Griffis.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Griffis makes a statement to the court. 
Global offer on all matters. 
Court will set for a plea and sentencing date. 
Court amends bond to NO Violent contact with Victim A only.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Hearing on August 8, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:25 AM Defendant Nicholas A Bohlmann in court with attorney Justin G Griffis.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Griffis makes a statement to the court and his client has just received new charges and Atty Griffis requests 90 days. 
State has nothing to add. 
Court will set a status.  Hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Hearing on June 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.

02:00 PM Attorney Justin G Griffis in court.   Defendant Nicholas A Bohlmann did not appear.   Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appears by authorization. Defense has not received an offer yet, has reached out to ADA Tempelis.  State indicates they will email the offer to defense.  Hearing scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
